title: Bossa nova
summary: Bossa nova (Portuguese pronunciation: [ˈbɔsɐ ˈnɔvɐ] (listen)) is a style of samba developed in the late 1950s and early 1960s in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.[3] It is mainly characterized by a "different beat"[nb 3] that altered the harmonies with the introduction of unconventional chords and an innovative syncopation of traditional samba from a single rhythmic division.[5][6] The "bossa nova beat" is characteristic of a samba style and not of an autonomous genre.[7][8]
